Class Character

java.lang.Object
game.characters.Character
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Player
public abstract class Character extends Object
The Character class represents a generic character in the game. It defines shared attributes and combat-related behavior for all characters such as Player and Enemy. This class enforces that all subclasses define their own turn behavior.

  • Method Details

    • takeTurn

      public abstract void takeTurn(Player player)
      Defines how the character takes a turn during combat. This method must be implemented by all subclasses.
      Parameters:
      player - the player affected by this character's turn

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether the character is still alive.
      Returns:
      true if health is greater than zero, false otherwise

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the current health of the character.
      Returns:
      the current health value

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Returns the maximum health of the character.
      Returns:
      the maximum health value

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int dmg)
      Reduces the character's health by a specified amount. Health will not drop below zero.
      Parameters:
      dmg - the amount of damage taken

    • heal

      public void heal(int amount)
      Restores health to the character by a specified amount. Health will not exceed the maximum health.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of health restored

    • getAttack

      public int getAttack()
      Returns the attack value of the character.
      Returns:
      the attack damage value
